title: Corporate America can't avoid one question. It's Tesla's fault
description: Tesla's $1.5 billion investment in bitcoin has helped legitimize the cryptocurrency as an investment, leading analysts and traders to ask which blue chip company will be the next to take the plunge, buying bitcoin for its corporate balance sheet.

title: Biden gets his first chance to fully exercise his power
Parler comes back online one month after going dark
description: Parler, the social network favored by conservatives, came back online Monday with a redesigned website one month after it was suspended by Amazon Web Services and effectively driven offline.

title: Kamala Harris' marriage could challenge a racial taboo
description: Nikki Buskirk was watching vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her husband Doug Emhoff wave to supporters at an Election Night celebration in November when the future second gentleman did something that made Buskirk glow with admiration.

title: NASA's Perseverance rover will land on Mars this week. Here's what to expect
description: Perseverance, NASA's most sophisticated rover to date, is expected to land on the surface of Mars on Thursday, February 18, around 3:55 p.m. ET.

title: 'Super Mario' saved the euro. Fixing Italy's economy may be a bigger challenge
description: Mario Draghi, Italy's new prime minister, is no stranger to high-stakes jobs.

title: French workers can now eat lunch at their desks without breaking the law
description: Many French workers can now eat at their desks without breaking the law.

title: First Black woman to lead WTO says she will prioritize fair trade, access to Covid-19 vaccines
description: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is poised to be confirmed as leader of the World Trade Organization on Monday.

title: American designers are moving away from New York Fashion Week. Here's why
description: When the Council of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA) chairman Tom Ford announced earlier this year that the organization would no longer publish an official New York Fashion Week schedule but rather an "American Fashion Calendar," the news confirmed something bigger than an administrative update.

title: World's third largest economy bounces back
description: Japan's main stock index soared to its highest level in more than three decades on Monday as investors cheered signs of a rebound for the world's third largest economy.

title: 'Revenge bedtime procrastination' could be robbing you of precious sleep time
description: After a long day of working from home, Hadly Clark spends her evening hours mindlessly swiping through her phone. She powers through her usual scheduled 9:30 p.m. bedtime in favor of online shopping and social media scrolling.

title: Arrest of climate activist backed by Greta Thunberg sparks outrage in India
description: Supporters of a young climate activist arrested in India over a farmers' protest "toolkit," later shared by Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg, have called for her release.

title: Countries on high alert after Ebola outbreak in Guinea
description: Guinea declared an Ebola outbreak in one of its regions on Sunday, after the West African nation confirmed at least seven cases of the disease, including three deaths, the country's National Security and Health Agency (ANSS) said.

title: Europe's richest man is joining the SPAC craze
description: Bernard Arnault, the chairman of luxury goods group LVMH, is the latest billionaire to embrace Wall Street's hot new way to raise money.

title: NATO Secretary General suggests US troops in Afghanistan may not leave in May
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg opened the door Monday to the alliance keeping forces in Afghanistan beyond the May deadline when the US had promised to remove its remaining 2,500 troops from the country.

title: Cuddling penguins and snorkeling alligators: What animals do to stay warm during extreme cold
description: It's not just humans finding ways to stay warm during this week's historic temperature plunge — our animal friends are too.

title: Machine Gun Kelly says he wears girlfriend Megan Fox's blood around his neck
description: When it comes to intense romantic gestures, Machine Gun Kelly may have been looking to Billy Bob Thornton and Angelina Jolie for inspiration.

title: The UK's surprising Covid-19 success story
Misan Harriman, Harry and Meghan's pregnancy photographer, shot to fame capturing BLM protests
description: Freed from the formalities that accompany a traditional royal baby announcement, Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, turned to a friend to reveal their news on Sunday.

title: Singles Awareness Day: The benefits of being single
description: An increasing number of people around the world are opting to go solo.

title: Presidential memorabilia including George and Martha Washington's hair are being auctioned
description: On Presidents Day, many are finding ways to honor America's former leaders. At an auction house in Massachusetts, some are even bidding on their hair.

title: Here's why Covid-19 numbers are gradually improving. (Hint: It's not widespread vaccinations)
Shirin Neshat on telling complex stories through art
description: In my artworks I approach beauty as a way to escape the mundane. Beauty isn't just the physicality of my characters, but their raw emotions, dignity and humanity.

title: Manchester United's Anthony Martial racially abused on social media after draw
description: Manchester United forward Anthony Martial has received racial abuse over social media following his side's 1-1 draw with West Bromwich Albion on Sunday.

title: Human remains found inside crocodile, amid hunt for missing fisherman
description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of a fisherman in Queensland, Australia, have found human remains inside a crocodile.

title: Canada's elderly are 'terrified' vaccines may not come soon enough
description: Back in December 2020, Canada's coronavirus vaccination campaign looked promising as first doses were administered. But two months later supplies are down to a trickle and some of the country's elderly population is concerned. CNN's Paula Hancocks reports on what's gone wrong.

title: Elon Musk invites Vladimir Putin for a conversation on Clubhouse
description: Elon Musk wants to have a conversation with Vladimir Putin on his new favorite social media app: Clubhouse.

title: Biden gets his first chance to fully exercise his power
description:
• Inside the new President's routine: Oval Office fires and early bedtimes
• Jeff Flake: It's time for the Republican party to move on from Trump
• Fareed Zakaria: Biden's foreign policy plans are 'worrying'

title: Watch out, Wimbledon! Serena Williams shares video of daughter Olympia training with coach Patrick Mouratoglou
description: At just three years old, Serena Williams' daughter is discovering that practice makes perfect on the tennis court.

title: Asian Americans like me are fighting hate with tradition
description: To me, the Lunar New Year before 2020 signified the abundance and joy that came with a sense of community. Growing up in Texas, we would go to a family friend's house, alongside other immigrant families, where everyone brought their household specialties.

title: Lindsey Graham says Lara Trump is 'the future' of Republican party
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) spoke out against Sen. Richard Burr (R-NC) for voting to convict former President Donald Trump in his second impeachment trial. CNN's Fredricka Whitfield and Executive Director of Stand Up Republic Evan McMullin discuss.

title: CNN Exclusive: WHO Wuhan mission finds possible signs of wider original outbreak in 2019
description: Investigators from the World Health Organization (WHO) looking into the origins of coronavirus in China have discovered signs the outbreak was much wider in Wuhan in December 2019 than previously thought, and are urgently seeking access to hundreds of thousands of blood samples from the city that China has not so far let them examine.

title: Cubans face an impossible choice: Go hungry or risk virus
description: Cuba's coronavirus cases are rising and as the country struggle to get control of the pandemic, food shortages on the island continue to worsen. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

title: Why this will be the hottest airplane seat in 2021
description: Premium economy. The two words might seem a weird combination in airline terms, since it's a rare airline where economy seats feel premium these days. But these seats between coach and business class on international flights were heating up even before Covid-19, and as we all start to travel again in 2021, they're set to be a must-fly for many passengers.

title: Rafael Nadal eases into Australian Open quarterfinals, remains on course for record-breaking grand slam
description: Rafael Nadal remains on course to earn his record-breaking 21st grand slam at the Australian Open with a comfortable victory over Fabio Fognini on Monday.

title: The filmmaker looking to solve 'the problem of feeling unwelcome' in golf
description: Golf has traditionally suffered from a reputation of being a tough sport to access.

title: Catalonia's separatists increase majority, dialogue with Madrid in sight
description: Separatist parties won enough seats on Sunday in Catalonia's regional parliament to strengthen their majority, although a strong showing for the local branch of Spain's ruling Socialists pointed to a dialogue, rather than breakup, with Madrid.

title: Israeli researchers offer good news on Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine
description: Pfizer-BioNTech's Covid-19 vaccine appears to reduce symptomatic coronavirus infections by more than 90% in the real world, Israeli researchers said Sunday.

title: 'Hi Mom. Hi Dad. See u next rnd': Daughter of Buffalo Bills owners into Australian Open quarterfinals
description: Go Jessica!

title: When the Dalai Lama dies, his reincarnation will be a religious crisis. Here's what could happen
description: A decade ago, the Dalai Lama set himself a significant deadline.

title: 12-year-old trial participant shares his experience with vaccine
description: Duke University is testing Pfizer's coronavirus vaccine on 2,000 children between the ages of 12 and 15 years old. CNN's Pamela Brown speaks with trial participant Caleb Chung and his father Dr. Richard Chung about the 12-year-old's experience.
